title: November 14, 2023—KB5032199 (OS Build 10240.20308) - Microsoft Support
text:
November 14, 2023—KB5032199 (OS Build 10240.20308) - Microsoft Support 
 
 
November 14, 2023—KB5032199 (OS Build 10240.20308) 
Windows 10

For information about Windows update terminology, see the article about the  
types of Windows updates 
 and the  
monthly quality update types 
. For an overview of Windows 10, version 1507, see its  
update history page 
. 
Highlights 
This update addresses security issues for your Windows operating system. 
Improvements 
This security update includes quality improvements. When you install this KB: 
This update supports daylight saving time (DST) changes in Syria. To learn more, see  
Interim guidance for Syria DST changes 2022 
. 
If you installed earlier updates, only the new updates contained in this package will be downloaded and installed on your device. 
For more information about security vulnerabilities, please refer to the new  
Security Update Guide 
 website and the  
November 2023 Security Updates 
. 
Known issues in this update 
Microsoft is not currently aware of any issues with this update. 
How to get this update 
Before installing this update 
Microsoft strongly recommends you install the latest servicing stack update (SSU) for your operating system before installing the latest cumulative update (LCU). SSUs improve the reliability of the update process to mitigate potential issues while installing the LCU and applying Microsoft security updates.  For general information about SSUs, see  
Servicing stack updates 
 and  
Servicing Stack Updates (SSU): Frequently Asked Questions 
. 
If you are using Windows Update, the latest SSU ( 
KB5032390 
) will be offered to you automatically. To get the standalone package for the latest SSU, search for it in the  
Microsoft Update Catalog 
.

summary:
KB5032199, released on November 14, 2023, is a cumulative security update for Windows 10 (specifically OS Build 10240.20308) addressing certain security issues. The update includes improvements for daylight saving time (DST) adjustments in Syria and does not present any known issues. Administrators are advised to install the latest servicing stack update (SSU) KB5032390 prior to applying this cumulative update to ensure optimal reliability during the installation process. This update can be obtained through Windows Update, Windows Update for Business, or the Microsoft Update Catalog, and will also sync with WSUS configured for Windows 10 security updates.

**Technical Breakdown**

**Vulnerabilities and Exploits**:
- This update primarily addresses low-impact security vulnerabilities within the Windows operating system. Specific details regarding impact levels and the types of vulnerabilities were not disclosed in the provided KB article.

**Installation Process and Prerequisites**:
- Ensure the latest SSU (KB5032390) is installed prior to this update:
    ```powershell
    # Install the latest SSU via Windows Update
    Start-Process "ms-settings:windowsupdate"
    ```

- Update sources:
  - **Windows Update**: Automatically downloaded and installed.
  - **Windows Update for Business**: Automatically downloaded and installed according to configured policies.
  - **Microsoft Update Catalog**: Available for standalone installation.
  - **WSUS**: Automatically syncs with WSUS if configured with the following settings:
    - **Product**: Windows 10
    - **Classification**: Security Updates
